instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on but 2 ports not charging ,
threads.message:
Macbook powers on and detects charger but top 2 ports won’t charge, both top ports get 5.15v 0.35a
Bottom ports get 20v, macbook powers on and seems to work perfectly it detects chargers on all ports but won’t charge  on top 2 ports, I’ve not had best luck with <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> issues so hoping it’s not the chips any suggestions,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on but 2 ports not charging ,
threads.message: Don't you have schematic/boardview to reffer correctly the ports???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on but 2 ports not charging ,
threads.message: On schematic just says j3300 im not seeing the actual port names  referring to store the top 2 on both sides, closest to power button connne Tor and cooler tobtiychbar connectors, I believe one goes to <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> the other goes to ub300

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on but 2 ports not charging ,
threads.message:
Please, put some logic on your job!

Clicking on J3300 pins, you will find which ones go to <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200.
Find ones from the edge of connector; will help you to locate the USB-C ports easy.
Take pins 3 & 53 as example.

Do the same for JB500.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on but 2 ports not charging ,
threads.message: that's what u thought, for some reason I thought u wanted different info, anyhow with that said affected ports are ub300 and  <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, both detect charger, both not charging, ports <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and ub400 both get 20v and both charge, MacBook powers on normally, and passes all other hardware test

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on but 2 ports not charging ,
threads.message:
The corresponding <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips are first suspects.
Not easy to find good chips for 01700 board.
